text.p: Brazilian food processing firm Sadia Concordia S.A. released the following 10-month 1996 earnings firgures.
Note: The figures are all in U.S. dollars and are not adjusted for inflation.
The firm did provide comparative figures for the same period last year.

However, company President Luiz Fernando Furlan told reporters that Sadia had been operating in the red during the first nine months of 1996, posting a loss of $6.1 million in the January-September period.
He said Sadia was able to reverse the losses in October due to higher domestic prices and sales ahead of year-end holidays, mainly as a result of increased demand for frozen turkeys.
Net profit for October alone reached $20.59 million, Furlan said, adding Sadia expects to post sales totalling $3.1 billion by year's end.
